apply_policy.instruction: Apply all MUST rules that match the current change scope. If the current task does not touch a scope, do not introduce unrelated changes.

rules.title: Landmarks
must_haves: Pages and app shells expose semantic landmarks (e.g., header/banner, primary navigation, main, footer/contentinfo) using semantic elements or equivalent roles.
Each page has exactly one main landmark.
Landmarks are not empty and are not used purely for styling.
donts: Do not create multiple main landmarks on the same page.
Do not wrap the entire application in nested landmarks that confuse region structure.
acceptance_checks: With a screen reader, landmark navigation surfaces a single main region and expected major regions (e.g., navigation).
Page contains exactly one <main> or equivalent role='main'.

rules.title: Page Title
must_haves: Each route/page sets a descriptive document title that reflects the current view.
donts: Do not leave the document title as a generic placeholder across routes.
acceptance_checks: Browser tab title changes appropriately when navigating to the page.

rules.title: Heading Structure
must_haves: Headings reflect the content hierarchy and are not chosen for visual styling alone.
Each page has a primary heading that describes the page (commonly an <h1> on the page).
donts: Do not skip heading levels solely to achieve a visual size (use CSS instead).
Do not use headings for non-heading UI (e.g., button labels).
acceptance_checks: Using a headings list, the page structure is navigable and hierarchy is coherent.

rules.title: Offscreen Text Utility (sr-only)
must_haves: Provide an offscreen text utility for accessible names when visible text is not present (e.g., icon-only buttons).
donts: Do not hide text using display:none or visibility:hidden when it is needed for an accessible name.
acceptance_checks: Icon-only controls have a programmatic name (e.g., via aria-label or offscreen text).

rules.title: Focus Visible
must_haves: All keyboard-focusable interactive elements have a visible focus indicator.
Focus indicators are not removed unless replaced with an equally visible alternative.
donts: Do not globally remove outlines (e.g., outline: none) without providing a replacement focus style.
acceptance_checks: Tab through the UI: focus is always visible on the currently focused element.
